title: Where to Find the Best Nightlife in South Beach
seo_title: Where to Find the Best Nightlife in South Beach
more_content:
The South Beach nightlife scene brings the high energy you’d expect from a Miami dance club. From Miami Beach’s newest upscale lounge to a neon-lit hip-hop club, we know where you can go to get your groove on in this party capital. Here’s a look at five of the hottest nightclubs in SoBe.

Bâoli Miami

This restaurant transforms into a chic club experience at night. Come early for Bâoli’s Asian American fusion bites and stay for the late night party paradise. Enjoy world class wines, champagnes, signature cocktails, and a state-of-the-art sound system featuring a rotation of the world’s finest DJs. The Bâoli brand has played host to some of the world’s most famous DJs in both Miami and Cannes, including Bob Sinclair, Tito, Michael Cleis, A$AP Rocky, Infinity Inc, B Crazy, and AVICII. 1906 Collins Ave, Miami Beach

Mango’s Tropical Café

Bring your party loving pals to this iconic South Beach venue. Mango’s Tropical Café serves up tasty Caribbean and Latin cuisine, but we come here for the nightlife. Enjoy the most happening late night party on Ocean Drive every Sunday from 1 a.m. to 5 a.m. during their Late Night Jam Sunday, hang in the Mojito Room or Vodou Room with a private bar and DJ spinning old school hip-hop and R&B, and lounge in the lush velvet booths of the Jungle Room for dancing, dinner, and bottle service. 900 Ocean Dr, Miami Beach

Twist

At first glance, Twist may seem like a tiny neighborhood bar, until you realize that the entry is only a portal to seven different rooms, each with their own genre of music and totally different vibe. The longest running gay club in Miami boasts professional bartenders, world class DJs, three dance floors, and some of the most outrageous drag queens in South Beach. The best part? This two-story disco never charges a cover. 1057 Washington Ave, Miami Beach

STORY Nightclub

The sprawling STORY Nightclub features five bars, bottle service, and frequent celebrity appearances. The expansive 27,000 square foot space is equipped with an epic infinite hybrid sound system, concert lighting and visuals, and an always-packed dance floor. If you prefer to dance to rap and hip-hop, this neon-lit club is for you. 136 Collins Ave, Miami Beach

The Bar at Dalia

Visit the Celino Hotel’s glamorous and sophisticated indoor/outdoor horseshoe cocktail bar for a late night cocktail. Miami’s newest ultra-chic hangout opens into a vibrant cocktail area, which features eclectic furniture, colorful accents, and lush greenery. The exciting new space offers guests a welcoming space with live entertainment, seasonally-driven cocktails infused with exciting new spices and flavor combinations, and hand-crafted variations on timeless classics. Coming soon to the new Celino Hotel.

The nightlife doesn’t stop here. Check out these other South Beach clubs for more places to dance the night away on your SoBe getaway: Nikki Beach Miami, Rockwell Miami, Cameo Nightclub, and Mynt Ultralounge.

Follow the Celino Instagram and post a photo using #BeSeenCelino to show us what you get up to in the new Celino District.

Get to your exciting plans faster when you book with Celino South Beach. Be amongst the first to visit the brand new Celino District when you book our exclusive pre-opening promotion. Receive 20% off our Best Available Rate and a daily breakfast credit when you book now with Celino Hotel.
